top_categories.workout_context: Burnt Bridge Classic's Gravel roads, Paved sections forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Burnt Bridge Classic's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
52ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Burnt Bridge Classic, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Burnt Bridge Classic. Train it until it feels boring.
62 miles on mixed gravel and paved roads burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
When someone attacks on mixed gravel and paved roads, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Burnt Bridge Classic, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Varied gradients on mixed gravel and paved roads demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on mixed gravel and paved roads. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 3,200ft of climbing on mixed gravel and paved roads does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Burnt Bridge Classic’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Burnt Bridge Classic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mixed gravel and paved roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, paved sections, wine country terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 62 miles of mixed gravel and paved roads in Cowichan Valley, British Columbia.
